name: Aspirin
description: Used to relieve mild to moderate pain, reduce fever, and as an anti-inflammatory. Also commonly used to prevent heart attacks.
usage: Take with food to minimize stomach irritation. Avoid using with other NSAIDs.

name: Paracetamol
description: Commonly used to reduce fever and relieve mild to moderate pain. It has no anti-inflammatory properties.
usage: Typical adult dose is 500mg to 1000mg per dose, not exceeding 4000mg per day.

name: Ibuprofen
description: A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used for pain relief, inflammation, and fever reduction.
usage: Take after meals every 6 to 8 hours. Avoid prolonged use at high doses.

name: Amoxicillin
description: A common penicillin-type antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections such as sore throat, pneumonia, and urinary tract infections.
usage: Take as prescribed. Do not stop the course early even if symptoms improve.

name: Loratadine
description: An antihistamine used to treat allergies such as hay fever and hives.
usage: Take once daily, preferably at the same time each day.

name: Metformin
description: A first-line medication for type 2 diabetes that helps control blood sugar levels.
usage: Take after meals to reduce gastrointestinal side effects. Monitor kidney function regularly.

name: Omeprazole
description: A proton pump inhibitor (PPI) used to treat stomach ulcers, GERD, and acid reflux.
usage: Take 30 minutes before breakfast. Do not use long-term without medical supervision.
